piece:
I wish we had hired a professional person to film it. Instead of asking your friend Lenny to do it.
#Person1#: This video isn't so bad. The quality isn't the best, but he does a pretty good job.
#Person2#: It's not bad if you like your unclear video. There are no changes between scenes and the lighting is terrible. At best, it looks like a rough video that has not been completely edited.
#Person1#: It is a little rough, I admit.

piece:

source: Create a brief story with the following title: Thinking of starting a Writing/Reading group. Anyone interested?</s> Story:
piece:
I think we need a break right now. We'd better go to the cinema to- night.
#Person1#: All right. Do you want to go downtown? Or is there a good movie in the neighborhood?
#Person2#: I'd rather not spend a lot of money. What does the pa- per say about neighborhood theaters?
#Person1#: Here's the list on page... Column 6. Here it is. Where's the Rialto? There's a perfect movie there.
#Person2#: That's too far away. And it's hard to find a place to park there.
#Person1#: Well, the Grand Theater has Gone with the wind.
#Person2#: I saw that years ago. I couldn't wait to see it again. Moreover, it's too long. We wouldn't get home until midnight.
#Person1#: The Center has a horror film. You wouldn't want to see that?
#Person2#: No, indeed.

source: Write a creative short story based on the following title: I do essays about my personal life, an unofficial hobby of mine. Is it worth keeping or should I just burn it away together with my burn journals?</s> Story:
piece:
I think you should have told me you had a girlfriend and a boy. What a shame! I thought you knew.
#Person1#: Well, I am telling you now. It is a big deal. You must be excited.
#Person2#: Excited and nervous. You know I must work on some basic conversation skills.
#Person1#: How much do you think a boy can take a girl to be his girlfriend?
#Person2#: Well, the boy take the girl to be her friend and then they go to her parents and get a hold of her.
#Person1#: I think you have always said you want to be close to your parents. I don't want to be far from them.
#Person2#: Well, that's my intention. But I am telling you now. I want to be more open.
#Person1#: You are welcome.<\s> Summary:#Person1# tells #Person2# #Person1

source: Write a creative short story based on the following title: Bananas</s> Story:
piece:
I have a problem with my cable.
#Person1#: What about it?
#Person2#: My cable has been out for the past week or so.
#Person1#: The cable is down right now. I am very sorry.
#Person2#: When will it be working again?
#Person1#: It should be back on in the next couple of days.
#Person2#: Do I still have to pay for the cable?
#Person1#: We're going to give you a credit while the cable is down.
#Person2#: So, I don't have to pay for it?
#Person1#: No, not until your cable comes back on.
#Person2#: Okay, thanks for everything.
#Person1#: You're welcome, and I apologize for the inconvenience.<\s> Summary:#Person2# has a problem with the cable. #Person1# promises it should work again and #Person2#

piece:

source: Here is a title for a story. Craft a short narrative around it: Bitterness</s> Story:
piece:
I put the cake away in the refrigerator. It has a lot of leftovers in it.
#Person2#: It has enough food on it, doesn't it?
#Person1#: Yes, it has enough food. But I am not sure if it will keep you warm.
#Person2#: How much longer will you keep me warm?
#Person1#: As long as you can remember.
#Person2#: How can you keep me warm?
#Person1#: By the way, get some garlic in your hair. That will keep you warm.
#Person2#: How can I get garlic in my hair?
#Person1#: By the way, also get some garlic in your cloth. That will keep you warm.
#Person2#: How can I get garlic in my cloth?
#Person1#: By the way, also get some garlic in your shoes. That will keep you warm.
#

source: Create a brief story with the following title: I want you.</s> Story:
piece:
I want a leather jacket.
#Person1#: What size, please?
#Person2#: Size 40.
#Person1#: What color would you prefer?
#Person2#: Let me see. Do you think a brown one will do?
#Person1#: Well, the brown one is beautiful indeed, but I think the black one will suit you better.
#Person2#: Really? Please get it for me.
#Person1#: Will there be anything else?
#Person2#: Is this dress made of pure silk?
#Person1#: Yes, it is. It's brilliant.
#Person2#: Is it washable?
#Person1#: Yes, it is. But you have to be careful.
#Person2#: How much, please?
#Person1#: Only 350 yuan.
#Person2#: All right. Will you wrap it for me?
#Person1#: OK. Here you are.

source: Create a brief story with the following title: The Tomboy</s> Story:
piece:
What kind of music do you like listening to?
#Person1#: I like music that has a fast beat and is lively, like dance music. You know, I go to a disco almost every week. Sometimes it's too loud though. You prefer classical music, don't you?
#Person2#: Yes, I do. I find it very relaxing. I often listen to Mozart or Bach in the evening after a hard day at work.
#Person1#: I must admit that I like several pieces of classical music. It's certainly more sophisticated that modern dance music.
#Person2#: Classical music is supposed to be good for you brain. Research suggest that it makes your brain more active. Students who listen to classical music while studying perform better.
#Person1#: Really? Perhaps I should listen to classical music often. I heard that listening to classical music is helpful in reducing stress.

piece:

piece:
I want to send the computer to my sister in Shanghai by logistics transport.
#Person1#: OK. Is it in the box? May I see it?
#Person2#: Yes. This is the computer and this is the keyboard and the monitor.
#Person1#: Is there anything else?
#Person2#: There are a mouse and a camera.
#Person1#: Is that all?
#Person2#: Yes. How much is it to send these things to Shanghai by regular delivery?
#Person1#: It depends on the weight of these things. Generally speaking, we will charge you ten yuan for one kilogram.
#Person2#: I see. Can you weigh them for me, please?
#Person1#: Please go over there to weigh them.
#Person2#: OK. See you later.<\s> Summary:#Person1# sends some computer equipments to Shanghai with #Person1#'s assistance. #Person

piece:

#Person1#: Thank you, Tom. I'm great.

#Person2#: Because I said I didn't love him.

#Person2#: Excited and nervous. I don't know how to tell him I didn't love him.

piece:

source: Using the title given, develop a short story: Mom is Full of Bullets: A Poem on mental health (open for constructive criticism!)</s> Story:
piece:
I really want to take a nap. I feel very sleepy today.
#Person1#: What's the matter? Didn't you get enough sleep last night?
#Person2#: I fell asleep very late. It was almost two o'clock in the morning when I finally fell asleep.
#Person1#: Are you worried about something? Why couldn't you sleep?
#Person2#: You know how it is when you're in a strange country. Everything is new, and you get tired and nervous sometimes. Then you worry about your family, about conditions back home, about your courses, about your money, about everything. I tried to fall asleep but I just had too much on my mind.
#Person1#: Well, take it easy. Things will look better tomorrow. Maybe you should try exercising or a hot bath to help you relax.
#Person2#: Anything is worth a try. But right now I really just want to find a quiet place to take a nap

piece:
I wish we had hired a professional person to film it. Instead of asking your friend Lenny to do it.
#Person1#: This video isn't so bad. The quality isn't the best, but he does a pretty good job.
#Person2#: It's not bad if you like your unclear video. There are no changes between scenes and the lighting is terrible. At best, it looks like a rough video that has not been completely edited.
#Person1#: It is a little rough, I admit.
#Person2#: There are problems with the audio, too. Some sections are no sound when the audio is cut. And when there is the audio, the volume isn't the same.
#Person1#: That's true. I guess, he'll do better next time.<\s> Summary:#Person1# wishes they had hired a professional person to film it and feels disappointed with Lenny's work. #Person2# tries to defend Lenny. #Person

source: Using the title given, develop a short story: You're my safe space</s> Story:
piece:
I want to send the computer to my sister in Shanghai by logistics transport.
#Person1#: OK. Is it in the box? May I see it?
#Person2#: Yes. This is the computer and this is the keyboard and the monitor.
#Person1#: Is there anything else?
#Person2#: There are a mouse and a camera.
#Person1#: Is that all?
#Person2#: Yes. How much is it to send these things to Shanghai by regular delivery?
#Person1#: It depends on the weight of these things. Generally speaking, we will charge you ten yuan for one kilogram.
#Person2#: I see. Can you weigh them for me, please?
#Person1#: Please go over there to weigh them.
#Person2#: OK. See you later.<\s> Summary:#Person1# sends some computer equipments to Shanghai with #Person1#'s assistance. #Person

source: Write a creative short story based on the following title: Nobody remembers the number between 3 and 4</s> Story:
piece:
What kind of music do you like listening to?
#Person1#: I like music that has a fast beat and is lively, like dance music. You know, I go to a disco almost every week. Sometimes it's too loud though. You prefer classical music, don't you?
#Person2#: Yes, I do. I find it very relaxing. I often listen to Mozart or Bach in the evening after a hard day at work.
#Person1#: I must admit that I like several pieces of classical music. It's certainly more sophisticated that modern dance music.
#Person2#: Classical music is supposed to be good for you brain. Research suggest that it makes your brain more active. Students who listen to classical music while studying perform better.
#Person1#: Really? Perhaps I should listen to classical music often. I heard that listening to classical music is helpful in reducing stress.
#Person2#: Yes. That's why I listen to it in the even

source: Create a brief story with the following title: People like me</s> Story:
piece:
I just bought a new dress. What do you think of it?
#Person1#: You look really great in it. So are you going to a job interview or a party?
#Person2#: No, I was invited to give a talk in my school.
#Person1#: So how much did you pay for it?
#Person2#: I pay just $70 for it. I saved $30.
#Person1#: That's really a bargain.
#Person2#: You're right. Well, what did you do while I was out shopping?
#Person1#: I watched TV for a while and then I did some reading. It wasn't a very interesting book so I just read a few pages. Then I took a shower.
#Person2#: I thought you said you were going to see Mike.
#Person1#: I'll go and visit him at his home tomorrow. He'll return home tomorrow morning.
#Person2#: I'm glad

source: Create a brief story with the following title: Dear Alexa</s> Story:
piece:
Hello, what can I do for you?
#Person1#: I want to open an account.
#Person2#: What kind of account do you want to open?
#Person1#: I want to open a current account.
#Person2#: I will open it for you right now.
#Person1#: What's the minimum deposit for opening a current account?
#Person2#: It's 10 yuan. How much money do you want to deposit?
#Person1#: Well, here's 3, 000 yuan.
#Person2#: Please write down your name, address and the amount of your deposit here. And please choose a passcode of six numbers and confirm it.
#Person1#: OK, here you are.

#Person1#: Done! What else should I do?
